entry.title: Heavy Snow Warning - Orange
entry.summary: On top of the snow that has already accumulated, expect 3 to 6 cm of snow to settle above 800 metres, and lesser amounts lower down. Snow is expected to clear from the south this afternoon. Impact: Travel disruption and damage to trees and powerlines possible. Cold conditions may cause stress for livestock. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Otago removed from Warning.

entry.title: Heavy Snow Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy snow above 300 metres, where snowfall amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Watch has been decreased to Low.

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is expected to low levels until 6pm today, and a further 3 to 5 cm may accumulate about the summit, with lesser amounts lower down. Between 10pm today to 5am Wednesday, showers may bring another 2 to 4 cm on the summit, with lesser amounts down to 600 metres.

entry.summary: Snow is falling to low levels today. A further 2 to 4 cm may accumulate on the road about the summit, and 1 to 2 cm down to Springfield.

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers are expected today and Wednesday morning. Between now and 7pm Tuesday, 5 to 10 cm is likely to settle on the road above 600 metres, with lesser amounts down to 400 metres. Between 7pm Tuesday and 10am Wednesday, further snow is expected to settle on the road down to around 700 metres, with an additional 1 to 4 cm about the summit, and lesser amounts lower down.
